intro: Fagara brisasana, commonly known as the Caribbean wax tree, is a species native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, waxy foliage that gives it its common name. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy, dark green appearance. Fagara brisasana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
